resources.string: The flag of Canada is a triband made up of a central white square. (called the Canadian visor because of this flag) with two red fields on the sides exactly half the size of the square. In the center is a stylized maple leaf. red with eleven points.

The flag of Germany is a tricolor consisting of three bands. Equal horizontals showing the national colors of Germany: black, red and gold. This version was first adopted as the national flag of modern Germany in 1919, during the Weimar Republic, until 1933.

The Brazilian Flag constitutes the national flag of the Federative Republic from Brazil. It consists of a green rectangle-shaped base, overlaid by a diamond yellow and a blue circle, in the middle of which is crossed a white band with the motto "Order and Progress", in green capital letters.

The Flag of the United States of America, often referred to as American flag, is the national flag of the United States. Consists of 13 horizontal bands equal, 7 bands in red and 6 in white, in a blue rectangle in the upper corner 50 white stars (specifically referred to as the "union") appear, each symbolizing a state in the country.

The flag of Japan has a white rectangular shape with a large disk. crimson (representing the Sun) in the center, and is officially called Nisshōki (日章旗 "flag of the Sun"?) in Japanese, although it is more commonly known as Hinomaru (日の丸 "sun disk"?)
